title: [Feature] Android Sharesheet
body:
Implements #2902 partially.

We cannot [exclude oC from sharing targets till API 24](https://developer.android.com/training/sharing/send#excluding-specific-targets-by-component), so we'll keep the previous behaviour for API <24, and use sharesheet for newer ones.

Old code will be removed when we upgrade min_sdk_version to api 24.

title: Fix remote service exception
body: Fixes #2953

title: Potential fix to anr related with camera uploads retries
body:
It may fix #2561 according to logs.

We have this log:
`Context.startForegroundService() did not then call Service.startForeground(): ServiceRecord{24fee0 u0 com.owncloud.android/.files.services.FileUploader}`

This code determines if it is needed to call startForegroundService.
`if ((isCameraUploadFile || isAvailableOfflineFile || isRequestedFromWifiBackEvent) &&
                Build.VERSION.SDK_INT >= Build.VERSION_CODES.O) {`

In the retry function, we launch a foreground service but we send only `isRequestedFromWifiBackEvent`. If it is not, `startForegroundService` is not called in the FileUploader.

With this change, we will send how it was created, and if it was created by camera uploads, it will call `startForegroundService`

title: [New arch] Get folder content
body:
Related with #2955, we need to get the folder content from the local database in order to show the file list, so this should be one of the first issues to take care of after the migration.

For the moment, it would be enough to retrieve a list of files and keep the previous behaviour.

BTW, we can include GetImagesFromFolder use case since it is simply an aditional filter in the database.

In the future, we could use Flow or LiveData to improve the performance and error handling.

title: [New Arch] Migrate OCFile to new database
body:
To continue with the new architecture, we will need to migrate completely the old file database to the new one (Room).

This step will help us to develop the other synchronization issues faster, because we won't need to take care of two different databases and different ocfile models.

But this migration has different inconveniences since OCFile is present everywhere, and we will need to disable some functionalities until we finish completely the rearquitecture.

1. FileDataStorageManager handles every old database queries. So we will need to transform those operations to usecases. Some of them are currently planned, others may require new issues. Including:
- Get file by path, id.. #2957 
- Get folder content #2956 
- Get images from folder #2956 
- Save folder/file #2958
- Remove file/folder #2864 (includes local removal)
- Move file/folder #2865 (includes local move)
- Copy file/folder #2866 (includes local copy)
- Conflicts management
- Av. Offline management
- Shared by link management

2. Since the main idea is to release a version once we complete the rearquitecture, we could disable some features temporarely in the new_arch/synchronization branch, and work in different issues. For example:
- Camera Uploads
- Downloads #2872 
- Uploads
- Av. Offline synchronization
- DocumentsProvider integration

Once we have a compiling version, @jesmrec could start QA on each single functionality instead of waiting till the end of sync rearquitecture.

### PR
- App
- Library (if needed)

title: Accept both display-name  and displayname as nodes in user endpoint response
body:
From https://github.com/owncloud/product/issues/181#issuecomment-685782818

two user endpoint returns inside its "data" node, different stuff:

/cloud/users/admin 

```
"data": {
      ...
      "displayname": "admin",
      ...
}
```

/cloud/user

```
"data": {
      ...
      "display-name": "admin",
      ...
}
```

App should support both

title: [BUG] OAuth2 + av. offline. Sometimes POST request to renew is not sent
body:
This comes from report in[ 2.15.1 ](https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2914#issuecomment-658268082)release: 

I'm able to reproduce by following these steps, but it's not straightforward. 

1. Add an OAuth2 account. It is a good idea to decrease the expiration time (i set 120 secs). I set several items as av. offline. I don't know if this will be relevant, just commenting to be more precise.
2. Let the token renew some times (two is enough)
3. Kill the app
4. Leave the device during some time. I did about half an hour
5. Reopen the app. 

At this point, the request is sent, we have a `401` , but the token request to renew is not sent. So, the account is frozen. It is not posible to authenticate against OAuth2 (basic auth accounts work fine)

![Screenshot 2020-07-15 at 11 53 00](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14894746/87531377-ed2e1800-c691-11ea-8468-34e533cbea2b.png)

Huawei P20, Android 9
Pixel2, Android10
Nexus 6P, Android7

title: Request previews for file types announced in Capabilities endpoint
body: Blocked https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/31267

title: Request previews for EVERY file type
body:
I assume there's a hardcoded list of filetypes where the Android app requests thumbnails/previews. Depending on the server setup, previews for more file types can be provided. The only way to make sure the Android app shows previews for all files the server supports, is to request previews for EVERY file type. Android app will receive 404 in case there is no preview. (same approach as in new iOS app and in Phoenix web UI)

In the future, server-side could announce in the Capabilities what file types have previews: https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/31267 (not implemented yet)

title: Use public preview API
body:
Currently (2.15), Android is using only thumbnails as part of the previews. (private API)
Request is ´api/v1/thumbnail/448/448/<path>´(private thumbnail API)

It could switch to the the public preview API:
`remote.php/dav/files/[user]/[file]?x=[width]&y=[height]&c=[eTag]&preview=1 `
(but there's no real urgency)

title: faster releases, even for testing purpose
body:
Open source doesn't mean to be slow.

What's about a fast release CI, to test and solve stuff much faster ?
This means
* every commit to `master` release automatic a version to Google Playstore **alpha** channel
* every tag release automatic a version to Google Playstore **beta** channel
* when someone decide, it's good, it will be manual moved to Google Playstore **release** channel

This implicit 
* a change in release versionName, similar like 999454800457b807c Otherwise it will keep the slow current mechanism
* apply a publish gradle plugin https://github.com/Triple-T/gradle-play-publisher
* changes in CI, best with Github actions
* optional a global error catcher (eg  #2726 It's an additional issue) 
* optional change in current git branching behavior, no more continue release branch.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3314607/89131036-532bf380-d50a-11ea-94e4-a0dc26b8c5fe.png)


Benefit
* less release overhead
* ability to test in alpha channel by user
* Google tests every commit too
* More testers (alpha and beta testers), means more error finding
* faster release to user 
* bundle resources to new features, instead of current endless release management 


## I could do this, if you want speed up your development

Go in touch with me, if  you want it @michaelstingl

title: Replace custom share dialog with Android Sharesheet
body:
Custom dialog has been replaced with android shareSheet 

after some research i have found this task could be implemented in two diffrent methods

First          : create A custom **BottomSheet** with ActivityIntent Adapter and follow the same implementation of the old 
                   DialogFragment 

Secound : make use of android **Sharesheet**
    **so**  my choice setteled with **ShareSheet** as it provide more consistency for users across apps
      **Please note** that android Sharesheet documentaion state that we should not customize our shareSheet to display our own 
      list of share targets , but it is considered but with alittle twist when we exluded **OwnCloud** package from the intent List 
      and **added** "CopyToClipBoardIntent" , but this twist won't effect the shareSheet standards as we **did not exclude** any of 
     Acquired **intents** of the **sharedIntent**


this approch has been tested in diffrent simulators with diffrent SDK vertion  and it's result has been compared with 
the old dialogFragment 

this approched has been refactored and applied  only for  the case illustrated by @abelgardep   #2902 
as the old DialgoFragment  **aka** "ShareLinkToDialog" is still getting used by another action **sendDownloadedFile(OCFile file)** 
but it is still applicable to adopt our soultion  if required

title: [BUG] add ownCloud url to mobile -> version is lower than 10
body:
Hello,

since the new android version (2.15), you cannot add the ownCloud URL to your app if the server has the parameter **'version.hide' => true,** in its config.php ...

All our servers are up to date:

```
# occ status
  - installed: true
  - first_install_version: 10.2.1.4
  - version: 10.4.1.3
  - versionstring: 10.4.1
  - edition: Community
```
Once I set the parameter to **'version.hide' => false,** it works again, I can add the URL of the ownCloud in android.

We tried on iOS or with the Desktop Client, none of them has a problem with hiding the version.hide ... why is it different ?

Could you fix this and revert to the previous behavior ? We shouldn't have to leak information for oC to work on android.
Thanks.

title: Permanent Authentification Error
body:
### Actual behaviour
I want do synchronize my Android tablet to my owncloud installation. The data is already on the server and contains several 1000 files and is about 20GB of size. It is mainly a download-only setup (just keep Android downloading new files without changing them back to the server).

In previous versions of the owncloud Android client I received several authentification failures during synchronization. It was tedious but eventually I managed downloading almost all relevant data.
Now with the latest update the sync-process does not work anymore: authentification failure is a permanent error.
I can re-enter the password in the account settings dialog which it accepts before saying again that authentification fails.

Concluding, owncloud client is not working at all for me.
Note that the password is correct as login in through browser works from same device.
Also, the android app works for the same server on another device and another user name (same app version).

This might be related to this issue I had a while ago: https://github.com/owncloud/client/issues/6843
Server support for HTTP/2 is unfortunately still not available. But I have this issue only on one client...

### Expected behaviour
Accept password and synchronize without crashing or authentification errors.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open owncloud app
2. Error appears 
3. (Re-enter password in change account dialog)
4. (Error appears)


Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)
No, not reproducible

### Environment data
Android version: 9

Device model: Samsung Galaxy Tab S5e

Stock or customized system: stock version

ownCloud app version: 2.15 (less severe with older versions)

ownCloud server version: 10.4.1.3


### Logs
#### Web server error log
N/A

[ownCloud.log](https://github.com/owncloud/android/files/4829146/ownCloud.log)
Edit: Removed server, username

title: [BUG] App never stops loading/syncing; I can't interact with it
body:
### Actual behaviour

Since the upgrade to 2.15, whenever I open the app, I see it loading.

Apparently it tries to synchronize my local folder tree with the server; but even after hours of this, if I open a new folder, it can't show me contents it didn't see before.

If I try to create a public link, it shows a loading bar and never completes (after 5 minutes I was tired of waiting and just closed the app). If I try to share a folder, it doesn't show me autocomplete suggestions, and I can't tap on "ok".

The problematic behavior was present right after the upgrade from 2.14. Then I re-installed the app, but the bug re-appeared a few hours after re-installation.

Another interesting component: instead of my profile picture, I see a default avatar. When the bug was gone directly after re-installation, I saw my profile pictures again. This seems to be related.

I have two accounts. One possible explanation is that the app worked until I added my second account; I have yet to try that out specifically.

### Expected behaviour

The app should be able to connect to the server, show profile pics, synchronize the file tree, share files & folders, and create public links.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Install ownCloud Android 2.15
2. Login to the account
3. Do something, e.g. download a folder, which should work, notice the existing profile picture
4. Login to a second account
5. close the app
6. wait one and a half hours


**Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?** yes, one of the two accounts I used was demo@demo.owncloud.org.


### Environment data
Android version: 9

Device model: SM-G900F Samsung Galaxy S5

Stock or customized system: LineageOS build 20200605

ownCloud app version: 2.15

ownCloud server version: 10.4.1, 10.3.2

### Logs
#### Web server error log

Exclusively log messages with the Android 2.14.2 user agent in the access log.

title: [SPIKE] Scoped storage
body:
- [x] Selectable? brandable?
- [x] Document providers integration
- [x] Migration from old storage
- [x] Android 11 -> MUST. Android 10 selectable. Android < 10 ¿?
- [x] Check the way files are stored. To know if blocks new arch advance.

### Interesting links and documentation
https://developer.android.com/training/data-storage/use-cases
https://developer.android.com/training/data-storage/app-specific
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RjyYCUW-9tY

### When Scoped Storage is a must?
It depends on which android version our app targets. Currently oC Android App is moving to Android 10 via #2576, and will use `requestLegacyExternalStorage` since it is not ready to move completely to Scoped Storage yet. [Source](https://developer.android.com/training/data-storage/use-cases#opt-out-scoped-storage)

When an app targets:

- Android < 10 -> Will keep using old storage access.
- Android 10 -> Default to scoped storage, but can request access to legacy storage by adding this flag into the manifest `requestLegacyExternalStorage` and setting it to `true`
- Android > 10 -> Default to scoped storage, and will ignore `requestLegacyExternalStorage`

### How to migrate from legacy to scoped Storage?
A directory is considered a legacy storage location if it isn't an app-specific directory or a public shared directory. Currently oC App is using a 'legacy storage location', so we need to migrate all of those files to an app-specific directory.

We could follow [this instructions to do it](https://developer.android.com/training/data-storage/use-cases#migrate_app_data) taking care when moving to [Android 11](https://developer.android.com/training/data-storage/use-cases#if_your_app_targets) . If we don't migrate those files and we change to scoped storage, [we will lose access to old files](https://developer.android.com/training/data-storage/use-cases#migrate-legacy-storage).

### Current behaviour 

oC App uses `Environment.getExternalStorageDirectory()` to get the root folder where every oC file will be downloaded. This return the primary shared/external storage directory. We can access this directory from computer, or almost any files manager since it is a top-level directory. This behaviour let users access oC files using any app that can read/write external storage.

Not only when app is installed, but also after uninstalling it, those files will be there until users remove them. This issue was reported several times in the repository. And with scoped storage, it won't happen anymore. A pro, and a con.

### Scoped storage behaviour

Android App will use `getExternalFilesDir` or `getFilesDir` to generate the root folder where every oC file will be downloaded. Those directories are app-specific storage and have some differences between them, we can check [this](https://developer.android.com/training/data-storage#InternalVsExternalStorage) to know more about them. If we store our app data here, those files will be removed once user uninstall our app. 

Using this approach, apps could access our files using the Documents Provider we developed some time ago and our files will be more secure because not any app could access them.

### Selectable, brandable?
For me, it makes no sense to have a selectable or brandable option to avoid scoped storage. Scoped storage is a reality, and we should adapt it as soon as posible since it will be mandatory in the long-term. Once we decide to move to scoped storage, we should move completely to perform the migration(legacy ->scoped) just one time.

### Providers integration
DocumentsProvider -> Works as expected, files are available through DocumentsProvider, and other apps can access ownCloud files the same way they were accessing before.

### Issues found in ownCloud App when using scoped storage
- Camera Uploads may stop working. Currently we are using a custom implementation to select which folder we want to synchronize automatically. 
We should move to storage access framework to select which folder we want to synchronize. We already moved to that behaviour when uploading files in #2436. We could use a similar implementation but using [this](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/content/Intent#ACTION_OPEN_DOCUMENT_TREE) to get the directory where our photos are stored. -> #2899

- Downloaded files on previous versions (legacy storage) will be shown as downloaded on new version(scoped storage) and each time we want to access to that file, a `java.io.IOException: Permission denied` will reach. Should be fixed on migration.

- Upload files: won't work since we create a temporal folder and store there a copy before uploading to server. Should be fixed when replacing `Environment.getExternalStorageDirectory()` with `getExternalFilesDir` or `getFilesDir`.

- Download files: won't work since we store files in a subdirectory of `Environment.getExternalStorageDirectory()` which is not accessible anymore. Should be fixed when replacing `Environment.getExternalStorageDirectory()` with `getExternalFilesDir` or `getFilesDir`.

### Old issues related with Scoped Storage (Archeology)
- Files remain if deleting account (#125) - Will be fixed if we move to scoped storage and use app-specific directory

title: Disabling oauth leads to NPE (AppAuth)
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Login in a OAuth2 account
2. In web UI, as admin go to Settings > Apps > OAuth2, and disable it. Also, OAuth2 can be disabled with the occ command `occ app:disable oauth2`
3. Refresh

Current: app crashes
Expected: Needed re-authentication, will be with basic auth.

Android 9, Samsung S9

_Originally posted by @jesmrec in https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2800#issuecomment-585201614_

This crash comes from the AppAuth Library and it was fixed but not released yet.
https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2800#issuecomment-585319714

title: [New arch] Multiaccount
body:
Moving to the new architecture the multiaccount management. Android app actually handles  three type of servers, from a authentication point of view:

- basic auth
- oauth2
- oidc

all the changes with any of them involved can be supported with the new architecture

- Don't log binary data
- Redact Auth header `(header] Authorization: [redacted])`
- Cut body after 1M
- Include X-REQUEST-ID in every line

- Include "info" / "header" / "body" in every line
- Optional: Timestamp, internal ID's and other useful stuff

title: [BUG] Edit different account credentials leads to AccountNotTheSameException
body:
### Actual behaviour
- When you have some accounts and you edit not the current one credentials, you won't be able to edit them.

### Expected behaviour
- You should be able to edit them.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Go to account management
2. Edit credentials for a different account (Not the current one)
3. Enter correct credentials
4. Account not the same exception is shown

![bug-lock-different-account](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47524927/83261627-eddf1d80-a1bb-11ea-9673-4cfe1d1fbfea.gif)


Problem remains in OCLocalAuthenticationDataSource, it checks if username differs from current account username.

title: [FEATURE REQUEST] Show "More" button for every file list item
body:
At the moment if I want to run an action on a file item like Delete, Copy, Move, ... I have to select the item before.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
It would be cool to have the "…" button on every file list item, like in the iOS app, which no longer needs to select the item, before running an action on it.

title: Not Syncing files on Beta version  2.15
[FEATURE REQUEST] Redirection callback from OAuth2
body:
When users have two (or more) different oC apps in the device, the OAuth2 redirection is always the same and user is force to select which of the apps should be opened. 

Android system will ask for that, and user can choose if the selection is `Always` or `Just Once`. In case the selection is `Always`, no matter which app triggers the OAuth2 authorization flow, from now on the redirection will point to the same (the chosen one).

So, the redirection, `oc://android.owncloud.com` should be brandable and code must be adapted for that.

Any further ideas and thoughts are welcome.

### TASKS

- [ ] Research (if needed)
- [ ] Create branch feature/feature_name
- [ ] Development tasks
  - [ ] Implement whatever
  - [ ] ...
- [ ] Code review and apply changes requested
- [ ] Design test plan

title: [BUG] Unable to log in with basic authentication
body:
### Actual behaviour
After logging in with a basic authentication type server responds 401 on FileDisplayActivity.

### Expected behaviour
After logging in FileDisplayActivity shows root folder correctly.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open app
2. Log in with basic authentication (not OAuth)

Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)

No, this problem can't be reproduced on the official server

### Environment data
Android version: 9
Device model: huawei nova 3i
Stock or customized system: stock
ownCloud app version: 2.15-beta
ownCloud server version: 10.1.0

I made a small research and found out that after refactoring on new architecture LoginBasicAsyncUseCase writes user id to the account name field, but in the last stable release a user name was written in this field. This behavior causes OwnCloudClient sending user id instead of user name in Authorization header. If i change user id to user name everything works perfectly. Is this a mistake or expected behavior of authentication system?

title: [New Arch] Download a single file
body:
Synchronization epic: https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2818

AC:

- By tapping a file in the list, a copy of the remote file is downloaded and stored in the device. 
- If the file is currently downloaded, check before if  new version exists in the server.
- Notifications: many notifications can happen at the time if many files are downloaded. They can be grouped from 3 different (pending to check)
- Progress bar to be updated during the action with the %. Also visible in the notification. 
- Once the file finishes to download, notification is gone.
- Errors in download shown in notification
- File is previewed after being downloaded

Errors: 

- No connectivity
- Server unreachable
- Error servers (file was remotely deleted, moved, maintenance mode)

### TASKS

- [ ] Research which is the best way to do it
